Class Menu

  • Object
    • Menu

  • public class Menu
extends Object
    This class is used to display Menus to the user and get his choices.
    Author:
    Vasiliki Bili, Konstantinos Marinakos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Menu()
      This is the default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getMenu1()
      This menu asks the user whether to input text from keyboard or a text file.
      String getMenu2()
      This menu asks the user whether he wants to see suggestions for misspelled words.
      void getMenu3()
      This signals the end of the program.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Menu

        public Menu()
        This is the default constructor. has no variables to initialise

    • Method Detail

      • getMenu1

        public String getMenu1()
        This menu asks the user whether to input text from keyboard or a text file.
        Returns:
        the user's text
        Throws:
        Exception - if the user does not give a valid option

      • getMenu2

        public String getMenu2()
        This menu asks the user whether he wants to see suggestions for misspelled words.
        Returns:
        his choice

      • getMenu3

        public void getMenu3()
        This signals the end of the program.
